meanings.definition: A tall ancient Greek or Roman jar with two handles and a narrow neck.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologist found an amphora buried in the ruins.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed an ancient amphora from Rome.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy waiter almost dropped the fragile amphora.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room like an empty amphora.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight glinted off the smooth surface of the amphora.

meanings.definition: A unit of capacity equal to one cubic foot.
meanings.sent1: The recipe called for one amphora of water.
meanings.sent2: The merchant measured the grain in an amphora.
meanings.sent3: The chef mistakenly poured an amphora of salt into the soup.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was immeasurable, like an endless amphora.
meanings.sent5: The amphora overflowed with memories of their travels together.
